Package pixLab.classes

Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • pixLab.classes.SimplePicture
      • pixLab.classes.Picture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DigitalPicture
    public class Picture
extends SimplePicture
    A class that represents a picture. This class inherits from SimplePicture and allows the student to add functionality to the Picture class.
    Author:
    Barbara Ericson ericson@cc.gatech.edu

      • make3D

        public void make3D​(int baseColor)
        Separates the image into two color channels and shifts it slightly
        Parameters:
        baseColor - the color of the first layer that doesn't shift
        • Red = 0
        • Green = 1
        • Blue = 2
        • Cyan = 3
        • Magenta = 4
        • Yellow = 5

      • make3D

        public void make3D​(int baseColor,
                   int shift,
                   int direction)
        Separates the image into two color channels and shifts it slightly
        Parameters:
        shift - how much the second layer is shifted (in pixels)
        baseColor - the color of the first layer that doesn't shift
        • Red = 0
        • Green = 1
        • Blue = 2
        • Cyan = 3
        • Magenta = 4
        • Yellow = 5
        direction -
        • 0 = Left/Right
        • 1 = Up/Down
        • 2 = Diagonal

      • scramble3D

        public void scramble3D​(int baseColor,
                       int times,
                       boolean slightShiftOn)
        Makes two layers of opposite color channels with the second layer being "scrambled"
        Parameters:
        baseColor - the color of the first layer that doesn't shift
        • Red = 0
        • Green = 1
        • Blue = 2
        • Cyan = 3
        • Magenta = 4
        • Yellow = 5
        times - how many times the second layer gets shifted
        slightShiftOn - Shifts the second layer slightly before "scramble" to ensure the whole image gets a 3D effect

      • scramble3D

        public void scramble3D​(int baseColor,
                       int times,
                       int shift)
        Makes two layers of opposite color channels with the second layer being "scrambled"
        Parameters:
        baseColor - the color of the first layer that doesn't shift
        • Red = 0
        • Green = 1
        • Blue = 2
        • Cyan = 3
        • Magenta = 4
        • Yellow = 5
        times - how many times the second layer gets shifted
        shift - how much the second layer should be shifted before scramble

      • grain

        public void grain()
        makes the image look slightly grainy

      • grain

        public void grain​(int hardness)
        increase/decrease each color channel for every pixel
        Parameters:
        hardness - the max value that will either be added or subtracted randomly to each color channel of the pixel

      • grain

        public void grain​(int hardness,
                  int exposure)
        increase/decrease each color channel for every pixel
        Parameters:
        hardness - the max value that will either be added or subtracted to each color channel of the pixel
        exposure - makes it lighter or darker
        • 0 = increase the color channel (makes it brighter)
        • 1 = decreases the color channel (makes it darker)

      • noise

        public void noise()
        makes the image slightly noise

      • noise

        public void noise​(int hardness,
                  double noisePercent)
        increase/decrease each color channel for random pixels
        Parameters:
        hardness - the max value that will either be added or subtracted to each color channel of the pixel

      • noise

        public void noise​(int hardness,
                  int exposure,
                  double noisePercent)
        increase/decrease each color channel for random pixels
        Parameters:
        hardness - the max value that will either be added or subtracted to each color channel of the pixel
        exposure - makes it lighter or darker
        • 0 = increase the color channel (makes it brighter)
        • 1 = decreases the color channel (makes it darker)

      • noise

        public void noise​(java.awt.Color baseColor,
                  double noisePercent)
        Randomly makes a pixel become a certain color
        Parameters:
        baseColor - the color to change the pixel (must be of the Color class)
        noisePercent - how much of the image will be potential affected
        (ex: 20 = 20% of the image could be changed)
